content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

The main target image shows two distinct structures:

## Structure 1 (Left Side):
- A tower-like structure with 3 layers
- Bottom layer: Two green vertical rectangular pillars forming a gate-like structure
- Middle layer: A yellow horizontal rectangular block placed on top of the green pillars
- Top layer: An orange cylindrical block topped with a yellow half-cylindrical cap

## Structure 2 (Right Side):
- A bench-like structure with 2 layers
- Bottom layer: Two red arch-shaped blocks positioned as supports
- Top layer: A yellow horizontal rectangular block with a yellow half-cylindrical cap at the right end

## Block Count and Spatial Relationships:
- Total blocks used: 8
- The structures are separate but positioned near each other
- Each structure has a base layer supporting horizontal elements
- Both structures use similar yellow half-cylindrical caps on top

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

For Structure 1 (Left):
- Two green vertical rectangular blocks (#5 and #6)
- One yellow horizontal rectangular block (#9)
- One orange cylindrical block (#11)
- One yellow half-cylindrical cap (#12)

For Structure 2 (Right):
- Two red arch blocks (#1 and #2)
- One yellow horizontal rectangular block (#10) - longer than #9
- One yellow half-cylindrical cap (#12)

# Assembly Instructions

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 5
   Step2: Move block with index 6
   Step3: Move block with index 9
   Step4: Move block with index 11
   Step5: Move block with index 12
   Step6: Move block with index 1
   Step7: Move block with index 2
   Step8: Move block with index 10
   Step9: Move block with index 12
}
```

Note: Block #12 is used twice as both structures have the same type of yellow half-cylindrical cap.
